roleset.name: rotation, motion in a new direction
roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: Member of VNcls crane-40.3.2, hurt-40.8.3-1-1, meander-47.7, roll-51.3.1. Checked by Julia, 11/2010. (from turn.01-v)
TURN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on turn-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls crane-40.3.2, hurt-40.8.3-1-1, meander-47.7, roll-51.3.1. (from turn.01-n)

TURNING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to turn.01-v and turn.01-n. Turn.01-v is a member of VN classes crane-40.3.2, hurt-40.8.3, meander-47.7, and roll-51.3.1. Framed by Katie. (from turning.01-n)

roles.note: Watch out for light verbs! (from turn.01-n) Watch out for light verbs. (from turning.01-n)

example.name: transitive agentive
example.text: John turned the key in the lock.

example.name: ergative
example.text: The focus turned to other fixed-income markets.

example.name: non-obvious direction
example.text: The reforms turned the economy around.

example.name: light verb
example.text: [The soldiers]-1 had been taken [*-1]-2 to the station after *PRO*-2 apparently inadvertently taking a wrong turn .

example.name: metaphorical motion with DIR
example.text: As the global economy enters a down - turn ...

example.name: more metaphorical motion
example.text: retired Justice Lewis Powell contested the notion that the last Supreme Court term marked a turn toward conservatism

example.name: clear-cut physical motion. Both args
example.text: It was all in his turn of the wrist.

example.name: remember VPs are PRD.
example.text: involuntary turning of her head to the right associated with worsening neck pain

example.name: arg 0
example.text: My turning of the key in the lock alerted him

roleset.name: transformation, becoming
roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: Member of Vncls convert-26.6.2, turn-26.6.1-1. (from turn.02-v)
TURN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on turn-v.02. Corresponds to Vncls convert-26.6.2, turn-26.6.1. (from turn.02-n)

roles.note: Watch out for light verbs! Also, arg0 is being left off because it is not clear that it can occur in nominal usages. If you see one, call it arg0 and send it in. (from turn.02-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The plan turned state companies private.

example.name: with source/start state
example.text: John turned Mary from a reactionary to an activist.

example.name: ergative
example.text: John turned into an activist.

example.name: turn down, as direction
example.text: John turned down the heat.

example.name: args 1 and 3
example.text: With the turn for the better in his father 's political circumstances , Ye Daying left behind his violent life and changed suddenly , becoming more inward - looking .

example.name: turn of events
example.text: If this strikes you as an extraordinary turn of events , well it strikes many overseas as nearly unbelievable .

example.name: all args
example.text: Hannah Arendt and Her Turn From Political Journalist To Political Philosopher

example.name: all args
example.text: It was the turn of the season from autumn to winter

roleset.name: idiomatic: turn thumbs down on = reject
roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: (from turn.03-v)

example.name: this really does occur
example.text: The voters turned thumbs down on the proposed bill.

roleset.name: depend, hang
roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from turn.14-v)

example.name: as the world turns?
example.text: Instead, it turns on the disputed and elusive facts of ``who did what to whom.''
example.arg: on the disputed and elusive facts of ``who did what to whom

roleset.name: produce, nonphrasal
roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: (from turn.16-v)

example.name: turn a prophet?
example.text: Why should they have to co-exist with [opportunists]-1 rushing in *trace*-1 to turn a quick profit?

roleset.name: turn 'one's back' or 'a blind eye': ignore purposefully
roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT phase 1. (from turn.18-v)

example.name: Typical usage, all args
example.text: It is to the great , abiding shame of women and blacks PRO to turn their backs on the great achievements of these people .
example.arg: on great achievements of these people

example.name: a blind eye
example.text: In fact , Japan is an island country , it has abundant tides and wind power generation resources , and the solar energy is also very advanced . However , they turn a blind eye to these advantages , having put their whole hearts to develop nuclear power over the past years .
example.arg: having put their whole hearts to develop nuclear power over the past years

roleset.name: reject
roleset.note: TURN_AWAY-V NOTES: Similar to the "rotation" roleset for "turn" above (from turn.04-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: John turned all applicants away.

example.name: ergative
example.text: John turned away from the stock market in disgust.

roleset.name: reject
roleset.note: TURN_DOWN-V NOTES: Compare this to the literal (non-phrasal) "turn down" (turn.01):John turned down the covers on the bed.In this case, "down" is the ArgM-DIR."Turn down" also occurs in the "transformation" roleset (turn.02) of the non-phrasal "turn":John turned the heat down. (from turn.05-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Separately, the Federal Energy Regulation Commission turned down for now a request by Northeast seeking approval of its possible purchase of PS of New Hampshire.
example.arg: a request by Northeast seeking approval of its possible purchase of PS of New Hampshire

roleset.name: give, hand in
roleset.note: TURN_IN-V NOTES: Essentially the same as "give" (from turn.06-v predicate notes)

example.name: turn_in-v: transitive
example.text: John turned the test in to his teacher.

roleset.name: surrender to authorities, as a criminal/rule violator
roleset.note: TURN_IN-V NOTES: Added by Julia, as this sense utilizes an argument not shared by turn_in.06

example.name: turn_in-v
example.text: Did the actual bombers turn themselves in or inform on themselves .

example.name: turn_in-v: with arg3
example.text: I mean Max would really be steamed if he thought his partner had turned him in on the armed robbery!

roleset.name: cause to be on
roleset.note: TURN_ON-V NOTES: (from turn.13-v)

example.name: tune in, turn on, drop out
example.text: But the genes were accompanied by a piece of DNA, called a promoter, that [*T*-2] turns the genes on.
example.arg: that -> a piece of DNA, called a promoter

roleset.name: cause to be off
roleset.note: TURN_OFF-V NOTES: (from turn.07-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: John turned the lights off.

roleset.name: cause to reject
roleset.note: TURN_OFF-V NOTES: (from turn.08-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: John turned Mary off on hot dogs.

roleset.name: cause to be off
roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: (from turn.09-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: John turned out the lights.

roleset.name: produce, create
roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: The higher-numbered args (2& 3) may or may not occur; here they arejust in case. (from turn.10-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: This factory turns out hundreds of mountain bikes every day.

roleset.name: seem
roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: (from turn.11-v)

example.name: sentential arg
example.text: It turns out that John never reads the frames files.
example.arg: that John never reads the frames files

example.name: split sentential arg
example.text: In last week's rape case, for example, [the girl]-1 turns out *trace*-1 to have been a victim of incest.
example.arg: *trace* to have been a victim of incest

example.name: with attribute
example.text: But in the end, everything turns out for the best, in the film makers' warped view.
example.arg: in the film makers' warped view

roleset.name: (cause to) turn out: appear, show up
roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: (from turn.17-v)

example.name: glitterati
example.text: Among the glitterati who [*T*-1] turned out in bipartisan black-tie force [*-3]to benefit the Coelho Epilepsy Fund last month were [*T*-2] Sen. Robert Dole, Rep. Newt Gingrich, and other kingpins of Congress.
example.arg: [*-3] to benefit the Coelho Epilepsy Fund

example.name: with cause
example.text: John is this policy of *PRO* trying *RPO*-1 to use the press as a whipping boy uh going *-2 to work *PRO* to excite the conservative base and to turn voters out in the midterm elections?

roleset.name: submit, give, exchange
roleset.note: TURN_OVER-V NOTES: Adding the arg3 to this makes sentences really awkward--only sportswriters would use it. (from turn.12-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: John turned all the evidence over to the FBI.

example.name: as exchange
example.text: Such is his reputation among the East Bay Bashers that when he hit his first career home run last season, [the fan who caught it]-1 agreed *trace*-1 to turn the ball over to him in return for an autograph.

roleset.name: (cause to) appear
roleset.note: TURN_UP-V NOTES: (from turn.15-v)

example.name: poof!
example.text: You never know where she'll turn up.

example.name: I said, 'poof'!
example.text: Though details were sketchy in the aftermath of the violent earthquake that shook the high-tech corridor along with the rest of the San Franciso Bay area, a spot check of computer makers turned up little, if any, potentially lingering damage to facilities or fabrication equipment.
example.arg: Though details were sketchy in the aftermath of the violent earthquake that shook the high-tech corridor along with the rest of the San Francisco area
a spot check of computer makers
little, if any, potentially lingering damage to facilities or fabrication equipment
